content.description: Start as far right as you can on the obvious crack/seam, and traverse left. Top out once you run out of crack. It has a lot of fun moves.
content.protection: A pad or two to cover the rocky landing... a spotter would be ideal.
content.location: At Temple Overhangs, this is a crack traverse.

content.description: Start on the left side of the flake at the base of the wall, move up to the shelf, then make a big move for the left end of the lip.
content.location: This is on the left side of the main face.

content.description: Start sitting to the right of the low jug flake on the left side of the wall. Do a few hard moves on gastons and a sharp sphere-shaped sidepull to gain the jug rail, and finish up and to the right.
content.location: Start to the right of the flake and to the left of The Dealer, sitting down low on an edge.

climbs.name: Slab on Front of Temple Boulder (sit start)

content.description: Sit start with hands on two good crimps all the way on the right of the slab side of the Temple Boulder. A high foot on the jug on the corner of the slab side helps. Pull on, and climb straight up slab on nubbins and crimps.
content.location: This is on the slab side of Temple Boulder around the corner to the left if facing the overhanging side of the boulder.

content.description: This is the obvious sit start on a big flake, straight up the face into the crack. From here, work your way directly over the roof via small positive holds, then to the bomber lip. I've seen it listed as V1, but even from the stand start, it feels solid. This is an excellent problem, it is worth a visit if you frequent the Alcove and want to try something new.
content.protection: It has a rocky landing, so bring a pad.
content.location: At the Temple Overhang, this is the obvious route straight out the roof.

content.description: Start on the right side of the flake at the base of the wall. Move up to the big shelf, then make a long move for the lip.
content.location: It is near the left side of the main face, just right of Sugarsmacks.

content.description:
Start as for Reefer Madness, but instead of climbing straight up, climb right around the bulge just left of the prominent ledge. Using the big ledge out right as a foot eases the difficulty a bit. This feels slightly easier than Reefer Madness. 

  The holds tend to be more positive than on Reefer Madness but may be loose. Tread carefully.
content.protection: Pads are nice for the rocks under the landing.
content.location: This is on the right side of the Temple Overhangs. It has a common start with Reefer Madness.

content.description: Start on the left side of the wall, move up to the big rail, and traverse right and up to the corner at the high point of the wall, top out at the corner.
content.location: Climb the left side of the overhang.

content.description: This is the sharp, crimpy problem to the left of Reefer Madness.  Start sitting down on edges and work your way up painful little crimps. There is a difficult crux move to a sharp, pointed hold, then go up the left side of the overhang. Super sharp, too sharp....
content.location: It is the left route under the Temple Overhang, left of Reefer Madness.

content.description:
This is another small crag east of Pusherman Wall.  It too is quite close to the temple.  It lies quite close to the street as well.  This crag is quite tiny, perhaps only 12 feet tall.  It can make for decent bouldering.  Beware of the landings.  There was a nasty landing below Reefer Madness.  

  L->R: 

  A. Far Left, 8.   B. Sugarsmacks, 9- or V0, 12'.   C. Pushover, 9 or V0+, 12'.   D. Natural High, 8.   E1, Pot Holder, V2, 12'.   E2. The Dealer, 11 or V4+.   F. Reefer Madness, 10 or V2-3.   G. Pot Holder, 10.   H. Marigold, 8. 

Temple Traverse, 10 or V2.
